channel.title: Old Time Radio Westerns
channel.description: First of its kind to bring you Old Time Radio Westerns Daily. Westerns that include The Lone Ranger, Cisco Kid, Challenge of the Yukon, Have Gun Will Travel, The Six Shooter, Tales of the Texas Rangers, Gunsmoke, Hopalong Cassidy, and many many more.
channel.itunes:summary: First of its kind to bring you Old Time Radio Westerns Daily. Westerns that include The Lone Ranger, Cisco Kid, Challenge of the Yukon, Have Gun Will Travel, The Six Shooter, Tales of the Texas Rangers, Gunsmoke, Hopalong Cassidy, and even the Roy Rogers Show.
channel.itunes:author: Andrew Rhynes
channel.itunes:subtitle: Old Time Radio Westerns

item.title: Mr. Jeffersons Dream – Horizons West (11-14-65)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Rhynes
item.description: Chapter #01 'Jefferson's Dream' introduces the listeners to the main players in the dramas to unfold over the following thirteen weeks. Captains Meriwether Lewis and William Clark are introduced, as is the huge mongrel that would accompany them for most of their journey. Called 'Shannon' in the Horizons West production, the dog's actual name has […]
item.content:encoded:
Chapter #01 'Jefferson's Dream' introduces the listeners to the main players in the dramas to unfold over the following thirteen weeks. Captains Meriwether Lewis and William Clark are introduced, as is the huge mongrel that would accompany them for most of their journey. Called 'Shannon' in the Horizons West production, the dog's actual name has since been determined to be 'Seaman'. Sergeants Ordway and Gass are added to the Corps of Discovery's complement of military explorers.

Original Air Date: November 14, 1965
Host: Andrew Rhynes
Show: Horizons West
Phone: (707) 98 OTRDW (6-8739)

Stars:
• Harry Bartel (Lewis)
• John Anderson (Clark)

Special Guests:
• Cliff Holland
• Dan Randolph
• Stanley Farrar
• Ben Wright
• Les Tremayne
• Tyler McVey
• Bill Irwin
• Dal McKennon

Writers:
• William Tundberg
• Carl A. Tundberg

Producer:
• William Lally

Music:
• Gene Twombley

Exit music from: Roundup on the Prairie by Aaron Kenny https://bit.ly/3kTj0kK
